an4.182:4.1: “There are four things that no-one can guarantee—
an4.182:4.2: not an ascetic, a brahmin, a god, a Māra, a Brahmā, or anyone in the world.
an4.182:5.2: No-one can guarantee that someone whose nature is to grow old should not grow old.
an4.182:5.4: No-one can guarantee that someone whose nature is to get sick should not get sick.
an4.182:5.6: No-one can guarantee that someone whose nature is to die should not die.
an4.182:5.8: No-one can guarantee that the bad deeds done in past lives—corrupted, leading to future lives, hurtful, resulting in suffering and future birth, old age, and death—will not produce their result.
an4.182:6.1: There are the four things that no-one can guarantee—
an4.182:6.2: not an ascetic, a brahmin, a god, a Māra, a Brahmā, or anyone in the world.”
